Danny Archer.Action: Says 'Say one for me, my friend' to Fawaz, showing some camaraderie.
Checks his gun and prepares for a potentially hostile meeting, showing caution but no aggression yet.
Approaches heavily armed rebels and tries to engage with a question, indicating a willingness to communicate.
States bluntly 'I'm here to do business,' indicating a pragmatic and possibly detached attitude.
Skills in bluffing and negotiation demonstrated by confidently presenting false papers and attempting to bribe the troop leader to avoid arrest.
Fails to fully control the situation as the troop leader finds the diamonds and draws a weapon, indicating a limitation in maintaining cover or avoiding detection.
Attempts to reason with Minister Somora after being attacked, acknowledging mistakes and expressing continued loyalty.
Remains composed and submissive despite physical abuse, showing a degree of tolerance and sincerity in trying to maintain the relationship.
Shows no visible retaliation or anger after being slapped and backhanded multiple times, instead tries to negotiate calmly.
Looks up from a game of solitaire as rebel prisoners are marched past his cell, showing some detachment or indifference.
Turns attention back to his card game rather than intervening or reacting to Solomon's plight immediately.
Pricks up ears and listens carefully when Captain Poison mentions the pink diamond but keeps playing solitaire, showing focused detachment.
Violently attacks Joost by smashing his head down on his knee, low-punching him in the groin, sweeping his legs out, and stomping him in the kidneys, then walks away leaving him writhing.
Calls out Simmons on the conflict diamond trade and confidently challenges him despite the tension.
Recognizes he's being recorded but chooses to proceed confidently without hesitation.
Uses insider knowledge about diamond stockpiles to pressure Simmons.
Bluffs about having leverage but does so in a way that unsettles Simmons.
Engages in a verbal power-play that is slightly risky but calculated.
Negotiates a finder's fee with Simmons, starting at ten percent and settling at seven after counteroffer and agreement.
Ends conversation confidently with a polite farewell and walks out, indicating control and composure.
Turns away from potential danger by avoiding the military jeep and nearby troops, not taking any chances.
Appears with a black eye and swollen face, indicating he may have recently been involved in a physical altercation or otherwise harmed.
Doubles back and sprints past dangerous rebel-occupied areas, showing awareness and caution under fire.
Successfully takes cover during crossfire and observes attentively before moving again.
Keeps moving despite exhaustion and filth, indicating endurance and determination.
No indication of panic or poor decision-making under extreme stress in chaotic urban combat environment.
Insists Solomon will come with him despite Solomon's refusal.
Attempts to gain journalists' attention by claiming credentials and story to get help.
Engages politely with the Australian cameraman, thanks him sincerely.
Explains the situation of the Mende farmer and his family, showing knowledge and concern for his plight.
Acknowledges mutual self-interest when confronted by Maddy about using each other.
Leads Maddy to help the man despite the systemic obstacles, appealing to her idealism.
Notices Maddy's expression and gently asks what is wrong, showing some concern for others' feelings.
Turns to Maddy to explain Solomon’s son’s situation, attempting to provide clarity amidst confusion.
Observes Solomon and Jassie's grief but does not intervene or offer comfort directly.
Admits to exploiting Solomon's grief rather than pretending to care.
Shares detailed information about smuggling operations candidly with Maddy.
Gives Maddy the biggest story of her career, agrees to go on record despite personal risk.
Instructs Solomon to pretend to be a journalist to get on the press bus, enabling him to participate despite his discomfort.
Looks around quickly for seating despite the bus being full, demonstrating situational awareness.
Commands 'GET OFF THE ROAD!' during an ambush, showing quick reaction and attempt at control.
Tries to take control of the vehicle after the driver is shot, showing presence of mind and initiative under duress.
Fails to fully gain control of the vehicle before it crashes, resulting in loss of control and accident.
Pushes the dead man out of the car and regains control by putting the Land Cruiser into reverse, forcing enemies to scatter.
Successfully evades an RPG by swerving at the last moment, avoiding a potentially fatal hit.
Recognizes that the damaged vehicle is hopeless and decides to abandon it and continue on foot.
Uses dead reckoning and the Southern Cross star for navigation to head north, showing survival skills in the wilderness.
Tells Benjamin to keep going and drive at the child soldiers to make them panic.
Thanks Benjamin sincerely for his help and says he won't forget it.
Smiles and shares phone contact details with Maddy, indicating openness to future communication.
Turns away without directly responding to Maddy's question about calling her, indicating emotional reservation.
Makes practical phone call regarding logistics, showing responsibility and consideration for plans with Fawaz.
Grabs Solomon roughly from behind and throws him to the ground, shouting aggressively.
Leads Solomon through dangerous terrain and protects him by taking cover during an ambush.
Admits to lying and being involved in morally ambiguous actions but acknowledges mutual deceit with Solomon.
Physically displays toughness and limps on, showing resilience without complaint.
Grabs Solomon's hand when Solomon tries to take his pack; they lock eyes momentarily.
Warns Solomon in anger with threat of shooting him.
Admits to lying about crucial information honestly when confronted, showing self-awareness and emotional intelligence.
Reads Solomon's true intentions and calls him out effectively, demonstrating perceptiveness and social insight.
Ignores his injury and insists he is fine despite limping and bleeding, showing stubbornness which may impair his effectiveness.
Hesitates but laughs and drinks from a black man's canteen.
Initiates conversation out of boredom, shows some interest in Solomon's life.
Refuses to let Solomon treat his infected leg immediately, grits teeth in pain but is reluctant to accept help.
Laughs together with Solomon despite discomfort and hardship, sharing a moment of release.
Engages in light-hearted teasing or banter with Solomon (e.g., responding 'That makes two of us' to Solomon's comment).
Calls the atrocities 'Animals' but offers no consolation or further empathy to Solomon; remains silent and expressionless.
Nods and pushes himself past the pain in his leg to continue moving towards water.
Ignores Solomon's offered hand when he stumbles.
Warns Solomon to back away carefully from the minefield to avoid danger.
Alerts Solomon vocally when Solomon starts hallucinating to snap him out of it.
Accepts Solomon's offered hand to help over a boulder, a moment underplayed but deeply significant.
Drinks water after Solomon makes a joke about waiting for beer, showing casual friendliness.
Pressures Solomon about his choices regarding the diamond and mocks the idea of searching the bush for life, showing impatience and condescension.
Correctly identifies the tree branch, demonstrating attention to detail and observation.
Questions the safety of drinking stream water, showing cautious and practical thinking.
Uses his map to deduce the location of the diamond mine by identifying river confluences, displaying navigational skills and strategic thinking.
Pressures Solomon to act pragmatically about finding the diamond rather than wasting time wandering, indicating goal-oriented confidence.
Struggles physically climbing the ravine and needs assistance, which might indicate some physical limitation or momentary lack of capability.
Shows concern for Solomon's safety ('I'm not letting you get yourself killed until I have that fucking stone.')
Coldly insists on calling in air strike despite Solomon's objection
Uses a SAT-phone to call for an air strike as a diversion, showing strategic planning and quick decision-making.
Displays confidence and leadership by insisting on controlling the situation and keeping Solomon safe until he secures the stone.
Kneels trying to figure out their next move, showing reflective and careful consideration before acting.
Springs out of the shadows and choke-holds a sentry, then drags him into cover and takes his weapon.
Threatens to kill if disobeyed or betrayed: 'You do exactly as I say. And don't mistake me for your friend.'
Curses as Solomon walks out of his line of sight, showing concern for his partner's safety.
Springs out of the shadows, subdues a sentry quickly and silently, then drags him into hiding; takes his weapon.
Watches under cover and tries to maintain line of sight on Solomon, but curses when Solomon walks out of view.
Warns Solomon firmly and clearly about the seriousness of their situation, showing confidence and control.
Scuttles through bushes trying to get a line of sight on Dia, but is unable to find a good position before sentries appear and start calling for their missing comrade who Archer killed.
Uses the SAT-phone to communicate and tries to manage the situation calmly despite injury.
Assesses his injury realistically and acknowledges its severity.
Continues moving forward despite severe pain and exhaustion, demonstrating determination and mental toughness.
Refuses assistance initially, trying to maintain independence.
Eventually accepts help to continue moving toward their objective, showing practical judgement.
Refuses help initially, insists on seeing the wound himself, showing self-reliance but reluctance to burden others.
Admits to Solomon that he suspected Solomon might want the stone for himself, showing some honesty and self-awareness.
Offers the precious stone to Solomon despite his own desire for it, demonstrating generosity and trust.
Tells Solomon to take his boy home, showing concern for Solomon's family and well-being.
Asks Solomon for help to put the weapon strap over his shoulder, showing vulnerability and willingness to accept assistance.
Pushes away the phone and sits back calmly despite being surrounded by armed mercenaries, showing acceptance and composure at death.
Does not attempt to fight back or escape when mercenaries swarm up the hillside, resulting in his death.
Promises Solomon Vandy that his family will be taken care of in exchange for the diamond.
Does not appear directly in the scene but is referenced as the one who promised Solomon his family’s safety in a deal based on trust and a handshake.
Skillfully pilots a seaplane over challenging terrain and lands it safely near rebel forces.
Checks and secures his weapon discreetly before approaching potential enemies, demonstrating preparedness and caution.
Approaches armed rebel fighters confidently and initiates conversation, showing confidence and situational awareness.
Misidentifies Commander Rambo as Colonel Zero, possibly indicating a momentary lapse in knowledge of key rebel figures.
Maintains a hard stance during negotiation, threatens to deal with the government instead, showing distrust and guardedness.
Closes his eyes to steady himself in tense moments, then chooses to accept the diamonds and leave peacefully.
Tries to negotiate and talk his way through a dangerous situation, attempting to reason with Minister Somora after being caught, showing some presence of mind under pressure.
Acts on 'a little initiative' without securing support, leading to capture and violence against shepherds, indicating a miscalculation.
Looks up calmly from a game of solitaire as rebel prisoners are marched past his cell, showing composed awareness of his surroundings.
Continues playing solitaire, appearing indifferent but carefully listening and assessing the situation regarding the pink diamond.
Focuses attention on the ivory charm while maintaining a calm exterior, showing situational awareness and strategic patience.
Carefully folds the ace of diamonds card and uses it to send a secret message to Minister Somora via a prison guard, showing strategic and sincere effort to communicate.
Turns away from Solomon’s angry glare and continues playing solitaire without confrontation or acknowledgment, indicating emotional distance and avoidance.
Responds pragmatically and skeptically to Fawaz's warnings, showing distrust and guardedness rather than openness or friendliness.
Calls repeatedly and tries to get someone out by instructing to mortgage the plane; persistently works the phone despite frustration.
Throws the phone across the room in frustration after holding for a long time.
Leaves the hotel without compassion, pushing past beggars calling his name.
Salutes the African bartender M'ed with his drink, exchanges casual, knowing banter.
Shoulders his way past the crowd, indicating a self-focused, brusque approach.
Engages Maddy with sarcastic humor and rough playfulness, showing a bit of charm and wit.
Describes corruption and war profiteering cynically, expressing a bleak worldview.
Responds to Maddy's questions openly but with no warmth when recalling the war and his role, even saying he 'loved it.'
Smiles and plays along with Maddy’s teasing remarks, indicating a certain friendliness and sociability.
Offers no self-justifying or sentimental excuses for his smuggling and mercenary past, showing a kind of blunt honesty.
Immediately realizes Maddy is a journalist and reacts sharply, showing quick perception and protective caution.
Throws money on the bar and brusquely ends the conversation, maintaining control of the social interaction.
Walks away from potential help, refusing to engage on Maddy's terms despite her provocation.
Reflects bitterly on his situation in solitude, drinks heavily, showing a moment of personal defeat and self-destructive behavior.
Uses swift, effective violence to incapacitate Joost quickly and decisively.
Pays cash for a round-trip ticket to London and confidently navigates high-security access (fingerprint, scanner, anti-ballistic door) into the Diamond Trading Company.
Walks away after incapacitating Joost without further checking or concern for potential consequences.
Uses sarcasm and insults ('Love the new hairline') after a tense business negotiation.
Engages in blunt, confrontational negotiation style, showing little concern for Simmons' feelings.
Acknowledges the harsh realities of the diamond trade with a cynical tone, showing no pretense of friendliness.
Calmly expects violence but manages to avoid conflict with well-armed men by maintaining composure and reading the situation accurately.
Shows confidence in facing potentially dangerous situations without panic or rash actions.
Thanks The Colonel politely for the offer to come back but declines.
Smiles darkly and is dismissive about The Colonel's information.
Appreciates The Colonel's offer to escort him to Cape Town.
Responds to ongoing conflict with a cynical remark about never leaving Africa.
Tells The Colonel he hopes not to meet again, showing blunt honesty.
Avoids military jeep loitering outside his hotel by turning away, showing caution but no interaction or friendliness.
Interacts with Med by asking him to look after his bag and compliments what Med has done to the place.
Ignores or does not engage with the young woman (hooker) beckoning him and offering sex, avoiding any friendliness or warmth.
Warns the bartender to get his family out before the rebels come.
Dismisses Fawaz’s concern about the farmer’s safety and downplays dangers.
Approaches Maddy in a crowded, tense environment, showing openness and a friendly gesture by asking her to dance.
Assesses the dangerous situation and tries to locate the farmer despite the chaos and danger of the rebels closing in.
Confidently dismisses Fawaz’s worries and moves toward Maddy, showing control and purposeful behavior in a tense environment.
Fawaz indicates risks and dangers which Archer seems to underestimate, possibly implying some recklessness or misjudgment.
Uses charm and social skill when interacting with Maddy, maintaining composure in a tense setting.
Invites Maddy to dance despite chaotic environment, engages in banter.
Responds to accusations of being a scumbag with sarcasm and jokes about childhood.
Stops dancing when confronted about compartmentalizing human suffering and politely thanks for the dance before walking away.
Smokes and stands quietly with Maddy watching distant explosions, allows shared silent moment.
Challenges Maddy on her understanding of Africans by questioning her exposure to Black people in the States, implying skepticism.
Does not directly answer uncomfortable questions about his past, maintains control of the conversation and atmosphere during a tense dance with Maddy.
Displays social confidence and emotional control while engaging with Maddy despite tension and provocative remarks.
Refuses to explain or justify past failures when confronted, arguably showing evasiveness.
Acknowledges harsh realities and hypocrisy but shows cynical realism about the world and his role in it.
Compliments Maddy on her smell in a somewhat sincere, if rough, manner.
Offers a grim smile and acknowledges Maddy's implied past or dreams in a moment of connection.
Analyzes complex socio-political issues clearly and realistically, showing deep understanding of the situation in Africa.
Acknowledges harsh realities pragmatically, accepts playing a morally ambiguous role ('I sell guns. If I don’t, somebody else will').
Advises Maddy to leave because the situation is about to become dangerous, showing awareness and caution.
Dismisses idealism and emotional appeals, focusing on practical survival and business interests.
Shows concern by offering help to Solomon despite mistrust, suggests finding Solomon's family when relief agencies fail.
Persistent in interaction despite Solomon’s rejection, prying into Solomon’s affairs which might be intrusive.
Implied involvement in corrupt or violent systems as accused by Solomon; contributes to country's troubles.
Does not fight when Solomon lunges at him, allowing Solomon to relax his grip, indicating restraint and understanding.
Explains the harsh reality of the diamond trade truthfully to Solomon, including his own scar and experience.
Pushes Solomon out of the way to save him from a hail of bullets, urging him to run for safety.
Slits the throats of three soldiers without hesitation to ensure their survival and escape.
Shows resolve and leadership by taking action to protect both himself and Solomon in a dangerous situation.
Identifies a safe place with journalists and arranges a meeting to use a SAT-phone via a contact named Fawaz, showing planning and resourcefulness.
Attempts to pass himself off as a journalist to get close to resources and contacts, demonstrating quick thinking but is called out and forced to give up.
Successfully locates and convinces an Australian cameraman to pass a message to Maddy Bowen, showing social skill and tactical networking.
Doses off under the harsh sun while waiting, potentially showing lack of focus or poor self-management in a critical situation.
Explains the complex ownership of Star Mines through cross-holdings and offshore banks, showing knowledge of corruption and the trade embargo violation.
Uses his knowledge of a Mende farmer's plight to negotiate with Maddy, leveraging insider information for cooperation.
Acknowledges mutual use with Maddy, demonstrating pragmatic and confident interaction.
Does not reveal explicit plans or next steps regarding how to address the blood diamond trade or help the farmer immediately.
Notices an old amputee man signaling for a cigarette, then puts a cigarette in the man's mouth despite him having no hands.
Takes in the full scope of the refugee camp situation calmly and without visible shock, indicating familiarity with hardship and ability to maintain composure.
Recognizes the old man wants a cigarette despite the man having no hands and skillfully adapts by putting the cigarette in his mouth rather than attempting to hand it directly.
Observes Maddy's expression and senses she is withholding information, showing awareness and perceptiveness.
Informs Maddy about Solomon's son going to school and reading English, demonstrating knowledge and attentiveness.
Turns to Maddy to clarify information about the children on the manifest, indicating communication and initiative.
Puts himself between Solomon and the guards to protect Solomon from being beaten.
Cannot watch the grief but also cannot turn away, showing a conflicted emotional response.
Grabs Maddy's arm to stop her and deny taking Solomon's son.
Puts himself between Solomon and armed guards to protect him from abuse.
Grabs Maddy's arm in an attempt to stop her from leaving, but she frees herself.
Shows frustration and harsh language but does not lose control of the situation or escalate conflict further.
Cannot watch Solomon's grief yet cannot turn away, indicating internal conflict but not paralysis.
Pores over a map with a flashlight to figure out exact locations, showing initiative to understand terrain and plan ahead.
Walks past guards with a casual wave, confidently using assumptions about his identity to move freely among the journalists.
Engages in light teasing of Maddy by finishing her sentence after she accuses him of exploiting grief, showing social awareness but no obvious misstep.
Explains in detail the diamond trafficking process and the role of supply and demand, demonstrating thorough knowledge and insight.
Considers the implications of going on record with a big story, understanding the personal risks involved and acting cautiously.
Encourages Solomon to pretend to be a journalist to gain access to a press bus, showing pragmatic problem-solving and confident manipulation of circumstances.
Warns journalists about the danger from the R.U.F. and urges caution.
Encourages Solomon to hurry up and leave the dangerous area.
Questions Solomon when he tries to help the wounded boy, showing reluctance to get involved emotionally.
Recognizes the danger posed by the R.U.F. forces and tries to warn the journalists to avoid going out and getting targeted, showing situational awareness and confidence.
Attempts to take control and order the group to hurry up and leave the hostile area, showing decisiveness and leadership under pressure.
Fails to prevent Solomon from staying and helping the wounded boy despite the ongoing danger, potentially indicating a lack of influence or inability to assert control in a critical moment.
Attempts to take control of the vehicle after the Cockney journalist is shot, showing concern and initiative to protect the group.
Expresses frustration verbally ('Bollocks...') when no seats are left, but does not refuse aid or help others.
Pushes the dead journalist out the door to regain control of the Land Cruiser and escape rebel fighters.
Commands others to grab their things and continue on foot when the vehicle becomes inoperable.
Uses dead reckoning to guide the group north toward the main road under the stars.
Responds to Maddy's question about the fate of people on the bus with a cold rhetorical question: 'You really want to think about it?'
Introduces himself politely and accompanies Maddy during the interaction with Benjamin.
Offers food as a form of assistance when Benjamin says he has no money, weapons, or fuel.
Stays silent when Solomon lies badly about being journalists, not correcting him or confronting the dishonesty.
Introduces himself confidently to Benjamin and Maddy, initiating social interaction smoothly.
Attempts to negotiate for food when other resources are unavailable, demonstrating practical problem-solving.
Does not show uncertainty or hesitation in leading the social engagement, indicating self-assurance.
Engages Benjamin with a pointed, challenging question about intentions and assumptions, showing awareness and critical thinking.
Observes the environment thoughtfully, then walks away quietly to drink palm wine, showing self-awareness and a moment of reflection.
Gets pretty drunk from drinking palm wine, which could undermine his clarity in a tense political context.
Shares traumatic childhood history with some dark humor and sarcasm.
Mocks truth and reconciliation process with middle finger gesture.
Reflects briefly on morality with a hint of cynicism and doubt about divine forgiveness.
Openly admits to self-interest and desire to profit amid conflict.
Describes his extensive military experience and dark past with confidence and cynical insight.
Acknowledges the difficulty of getting the diamond but still fixates on it as his ticket out.
Does not fully think through his escape plan beyond acquiring the diamond.
Commands to keep going and directs the driver to drive at the child soldier roadblock, anticipating they will panic and not shoot.
Urgently tends to wounded Benjamin, giving instructions to keep him alive and pushing the car to speed away from danger.
Uses profanity in stressful situation but remains focused on saving injured man.
Offers a momentary sarcastic comment ('A fucking comedian') to Benjamin despite the severity of his injury.
Greets Joost with a sarcastic but friendly remark, 'Good to see you, too, Joost.'
Asks Maddy to deliver a lighthearted compliment to the mercenary guard, 'Go tell that guard you want to put his face on the cover of Soldier of Fortune magazine.'
Demonstrates pragmatic and self-interested behavior by focusing on mining concessions and making deals with the Colonel.
Dismissed by the Colonel without much personal regard, suggesting Archer is seen as a mercenary rather than a trustworthy or warm person.
Asks Maddy to help him despite her reluctance and sadness, showing persistence but little emotional connection.
Confidently negotiates and challenges the Colonel about the mining concession, showing awareness of the situation and stakes.
Makes a quick decision to go in with Solomon despite the dangers, implying calculated risk-taking and confidence.
Attempts to use Maddy to gain access via the mercenary guard, showing strategic thinking and resourcefulness.
Thanks Maddy for keeping her end of the deal and exchanges a sincere, meaningful look with her.
Edges past the young mercenary without interaction, prioritizing stealing supplies rather than engaging with others.
Wishes Maddy well by telling her to find a good man and that she deserves to be happy.

Edges past the young mercenary unnoticed to get to the back of the tent, quickly forages and gathers essential supplies including K-rations, GPS, first-aid kit, and a sat-phone, demonstrating preparedness and tactical awareness.
Waits behind a tent with his pack ready, maintaining a low profile and readiness for departure, showing situational awareness and strategic planning.
Instinctively grabs Solomon and orders him off after he tries to approach a dangerous passing truck, preventing Solomon from potentially being captured or exposed.
Navigates harsh jungle terrain and survives an intense gunfight, continuing to evade pursuers despite exhaustion and injury.
Falls and becomes winded during the escape, momentarily compromising his ability to flee effectively.
Pulls his Sig-Sauer 9mm and threatens Solomon to shoot him if he tries to leave.
Attempts to walk despite excruciating pain from his wound, showing determination and endurance.
Fails to respond effectively to Solomon's offer of forgiveness and help, showing confusion and emotional unpreparedness.
Frantically brushes off ants covering his body, demonstrates a natural and immediate physical reaction to discomfort and danger.
Laughs with Solomon at shared misfortune, showing emotional resilience and ability to use humor as a coping mechanism.
Responds calmly and wittily to Solomon's confusion about white people, showing self-awareness and social intelligence.
Sees the mass grave and calls the perpetrators 'Animals', but offers no further insight or action.
Remains silent and offers no direct response or plan of action after witnessing the mass grave and emotional distress of Solomon.
Attempts to take a clean shot to rescue Solomon despite difficult conditions.
Is captured and made to kneel with arms tied and gun to his head, showing no resistance or further attempts to help in this moment.
Watches Solomon closely and sneakily checks his watch during a tense moment, showing detached observation rather than intervention.
Surreptitiously glances at his watch multiple times to track timing carefully, anticipating an air strike that does not come on schedule.
Keeps a close watch on Solomon's behavior, showing situational awareness and attentiveness.
Rolls behind a tree to take cover during intense gunfire, showing tactical awareness and quick reflexes.
Sprints toward Dia despite hands being tied, performs a bodycheck to incapacitate a soldier, and protects the boy by throwing himself on top of him under fire.
Thanks the Colonel for calling in the location of the diamond field.
Nods in agreement when acknowledging he and the Colonel both want the diamond.
Calls in the location of the enemy to the Colonel, facilitating their quick arrival and attack.
Acknowledges having an ulterior motive in aiding the Colonel, showing strategic calculation.
Cooperates with the Colonel by introducing Solomon, showing awareness of power dynamics and social navigation.
Understands Solomon's coded warning about the land mine, showing attentiveness and care for others' safety.
Recognizes Solomon's coded warning about the land mine trigger, demonstrating awareness and perception in a tense situation.
Does not physically intervene to stop Joost from stepping on the land mine trigger despite recognizing the danger.
Seizes moment to protect Solomon and Dia by attacking mercenaries, despite personal risk
Commands Solomon to stay down and directs urgent action, showing leadership and concern for their safety
Admires Solomon with a teasing 'you lying bastard' remark after Solomon digs up evidence, showing camaraderie
Prepares to escape quickly after the gunfire, prioritizing self-preservation
Observed silently by Dia holding a gun on him, indicating tense and possibly mistrustful dynamic
Walks up to Dia ignoring the gun and hugs him, showing physical affection and reassurance.
Commands Solomon and Dia to move and provides covering fire for their escape, putting himself at risk to protect them.
Keeps going despite being wounded, continuing to lead and communicate important information for their survival.
Despite being severely wounded and gasping for breath, he insists on examining the stone himself and recognizes its true value.
Commands Solomon to stop helping him up to maintain control of the situation even while injured.
Shows clear awareness of others' intentions, acknowledging the possibility of theft and manipulation in a calm manner.
Injured and weakened, he still tries to pick up and properly carry the machine gun, demonstrating focus and preparation for defense.
Smiles and delivers a warning to Solomon about Fawaz, showing a protective instinct.
Takes cover and provides gunfire to cover Solomon and Dia's escape, demonstrating concern for their safety.
Calls Maddy, showing vulnerability and asking for help despite his situation, indicating trust and sincerity.
Tells Maddy to 'shut up and listen' in a moment of urgency and weakness, showing impatience and brusqueness.
Fires bursts from his machine gun to cover Solomon and Dia's escape, demonstrating tactical awareness and combat skill.
Uses a SAT-phone to contact Maddy, coordinating help under pressure and while injured, showing presence of mind and resourcefulness.
Maintains composure and gives clear instructions despite weakness and labored breathing, reflecting confidence and mental resilience.
Tells Maddy to take care of Solomon and tell his story despite being severely wounded.
Hangs up on Maddy and does not ask for help or show overt vulnerability in his final moments.
Sits peacefully in his final moments, showing acceptance rather than fighting back or lashing out.
Negotiates a deal involving a diamond and payment, with conditions protecting Solomon's family, demonstrating strategic planning and leveraging trust.
